content: cardigan for a stuffy by dani finished product is a cute little granny square cardigan fitting my build-a-bear frog his name is jason funderburker it s pretty long on him so maybe it s more of a duster… anyway materials ● approx 1 skein less than 232 yds yarn of your choice ○ example is worsted/aran/size 4 yarn bee soft n sleek i bought this before i decided to stop shopping at hobby lobby don t judge ● approx 1 skein of contrasting color if desired ● appropriately-sized hook ○ example made with 6 5mm ● stuffed model ● hope dreams and sheer force of will measurements if you want your cardigan to be a different size than mine you ll want to take some measurements i took my stuffy s measurements and found that he s about 16 in s wide around at his hip so i knew i wanted the finished product to be about 8ish in s wide when lying flat therefore each square should be about 4 in s my yarn is pretty dense and i was using a big ish hook so each square was only 4 rounds if you have a different gauge different yarn or a different hook you might have to do more or fewer rounds instructions 1 make 10 granny squares using the pattern of your choice reaching the measurements desired each of my squares was about 4 in s wide a i used this pattern https //vivcrochets com/crochet-perfect-granny-square-no-twisting/ b make them in whatever color makes you happy i like monochrome squares so that s how i made mine 2 make 2 half granny squares using pattern of your choice reaching the same width as your full granny squares a i used this pattern https //offthebeatenhook com/crochet-half-granny-square/ b again use the colors that you like 3 optional if you want yours to lay super flat and look really nice you might want to block your squares before seaming i personally didn t 4 seaming time a note use the seaming style of your choice i used a really wack seaming stitch i m not sure if it has a name so if you want yours to look just like mine you might have to do a ritual to read my mind basically i work up and down through both loops then once i reach the end i turn around and work up and down the opposite stitches forming a loop around each pair of stitches i like this method because it ends up being decorative especially if you use a contrast color like i did but if you don t like that method i don t blame you do what feels right b follow diagram a to seam up the back c follow diagram b to seam up the front d follow diagram c to seam the back and front together e follow diagram d to make sleeve x2 f follow diagram e to seam sleeves to body 5 optional looks
